publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4167 Stuart McMillan: Royal Scots Dragoon Guards, Classical Winners—That the Parliament congratulates the pipe band of the Royal Scots Dragoon Guards for winning the Classical Brit Album of the Year 2009 with Spirit of the Glen - Journey; notes that the regimental band has the first instrumental album to win the category and that its band members are the first non-musicians to win the award; further notes that the album was recorded during the regiment’s tour of duty in Iraq, making it the first winning album to be recorded in a war-torn country, and also notes the value of regimental pipe bands in boosting the morale of troops and engaging the community both at home and when abroad. Supported by: Robin Harper*, Christina McKelvie*, Murdo Fraser*, Alasdair Allan*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Rob Gibson*, Bill Kidd*, Bob Doris*, Jim Tolson*, Kenneth Gibson*, Sandra White*
S3M-4167 Royal Scots Dragoon Guards, Classical Winners (lodged on 18 May 2009) Gil Paterson*
